thread.title: Chelsea Manning to lose transgender benefits with dishonorable discharge
thread.title_full: Chelsea Manning to lose transgender benefits with dishonorable discharge

author: USA TODAY
title: Chelsea Manning to lose transgender benefits with dishonorable discharge
text:
Chelsea Manning to lose transgender benefits with dishonorable discharge Chelsea Manning, the national-security leaker and transgender soldier, will lose her entitlement to military health-care benefits Post to Facebook Chelsea Manning to lose transgender benefits with dishonorable discharge Chelsea Manning, the national-security leaker and transgender soldier, will lose her entitlement to military health-care benefits  //usat.ly/2k1FFJe   Join the Nation's Conversation   Chelsea Manning to lose transgender benefits with dishonorable discharge Tom Vanden Brook , USA TODAY 6:28 p.m. ET Jan. 18, 2017 An undated file photo provided by the U.S. Army of Pfc. Chelsea Manning. (Photo: AP) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WASHINGTON — Army Pvt. Chelsea Manning, the national-security leaker and transgender soldier, will lose her entitlement to military health-care benefits under the terms of the sentence that President Obama commuted, according to the Army. 
Obama’s commutation Tuesday will allow Manning to leave the Army’s prison at Fort Leavenworth on May 17, about six years before she would have been eligible for parole. The Army has been providing her with treatment for gender dysphoria, including hormone treatments. 
She had been a candidate for gender-reassignment surgery, which would have been paid for under the Pentagon’s new policy for transgender troops. 
But the terms of the 35-year sentence the court-martial imposed includes a “dishonorable discharge,” which the commutation did not affect, Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said Wednesday. 
“If Pvt. Manning is discharged with a dishonorable discharge, she will lose her entitlement to (military) benefits, including gender-transition care at (military) medical treatment facilities,” Smith said.
